title: Ray Domenge
text:
Ray Domenge (born June 5, 1965) is an American retired <a href="boxing">boxer</a> who unsuccessfully challenged <a href="Mario%20Veit">Mario Veit</a> for his <a href="World%20Boxing%20Organization">WBO</a> Intercontinental <a href="super%20middleweight">super middleweight</a> title in 1999. He fought <a href="Rob%20Calloway">Rob Calloway</a> for the WAA Light Heavyweight Title but lost by TKO in 1996.
He won the WAA Light Heavyweight Title in 1997 against Allen Smith by KO. He also won the WAA Middleweight Title in 1999 against Johnathan Corn. He was going for his 3rd title against <a href="Mario%20Veit">Mario Veit</a> for the WBO Inter-Continental super middleweight title but lost by the scorecards.
Domenge also fought against the legend <a href="Roberto%20Dur%C3%A1n">Roberto Durán</a> in 1996 but lost the fight due to scorecard.
Domenge's last fight was against <a href="Juergen%20Braehmer">Juergen Braehmer</a> who knocked Domenge out in 25 seconds.
